name: Melia Luxembourg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually book hotels on hotwire, priceline, or expedia, but were pleased to find an excellent rate on this hotel's website that also offered a food credit of 15 Euros per person per day. This was a great deal that definitely increased the value of our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is sleek, modern, and extremely clean. The MUDAM and brand new "Three Acorns" museum are right next door. Some might find it to be too far of a walk from the city's centre (approximately 15 minutes), but we ended up enjoying being a little ways away from the hustle and bustle. In fact, we found the Melia to be a very quiet and peaceful reprieve, which was the perfect start to our European vacation.
reviews.title: Peaceful Stay at Hotel Melia.

reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of April/12 and were delighted. The front desk was efficient and most helpful whenever we approached them for directions, etc. Our room was quite large and ery quiet at night and the bed was most comfortable. The room also had more than adequate lighting for reading at night, something many hotel rooms lack. The bathroom was done in marble and was also quite large. Now we did stay on the executive floor, which wasn't that much more but if I recall correctly, wifi was included on that floor. Every afternoon, the hotel served complementary wine and appetizers in the lobby and the outside patio which was lovely. I should say that these weren't just nuts and crackers but were quite elaborate hot and cold appetizers which were served buffet style. There was a nice assortment of wines to choose from and all of this was complementary to all hotel guests. At least I assume so since no one asked for our room number. Breakfast was served in a lovely airy dining room on the second floor and included a wondrous array of first rate breakfast items as well as specialties created for the day. One of the nicest breakfasts of our trip. (we stayed here for two nights).
reviews.title: Superbe accomodation and food

reviews.text: This hotel is situated at the edge of a new business district which you really don't see. what you do see is the forest located on almost every side of the hotel, except for one side which faces the remains of a grand old stone fortress which is being incorporated into the design of an art museum. Wonderful to view and photograph. We did discover that it is too far to walk to any part of the old city so we hailed a cab partway down the hill and had a typically expensive drive for a prosperous European city. While downtown, we discovered that there existed the Hop on Hop off Bus, which we always take wherever we find it's available. We had a great ride, getting off at all the high spots we wanted to see as well as the shopping area. Weren't we thrilled to find out that one of the stops was outside our hotel! I must admit that I almost didn't book this hotel because of its exterior in the online photograph. It looks like a large ugly box that has an exterior made of some kind of roughed up material. Well I can say that it does look much better in person but it should look much better in person than it does. Some architect got a bit carried away with nouveau exteriors. But the high quality of everything inside the building causes you to forget about the exterior. Luxembourg City is a fabulous place to visit and this hotel is tops.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms for an overnight stay in Luxembourg. Sat nav took us close to the hotel which seems to be located in a business park a few minutes drive away from the old city. Easy parking at the car park nearby. The hotel seems very new and the reception were friendly, offering us some juice to drink during check in. They also offered us half price breakfasts if we joined the hotel loyalty scheme ... sure why not?
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upstairs, we found the rooms modern with quality fixtures and fittings and plenty of channels on the TV. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Delightful with some needs of improvement...

reviews.text: I stayed here four nights as part of my holiday around BENELUX countries. Clean, modern, well priced, great views over Luxembourg. Talk a walk down to Clausen - it's really happening down there with cool bars and restaurants. The only issue about the Melia is that its about a 20/30 minute walk to the centre of Luxembourg across a wonderful bridge. The car park next door proved very affordablle. In summary: big, stylish rooms, good breakfasts, unintrusive staff and service. Love it.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is a nice modern hotel sitting in a position high above the gorge, which offers nice views of the lower city, next to the Philharmonie in the Kirchberg area. We found the hotel to be of high standard and was great value. There is a car park right next to the hotel with a pretty good rate if travelling by car. The road directly in front of the hotel winds down into the lower parts of the city close to the Bock Casemates, and is probably within walking distance to the Bock and the other landmarks in the city, I also noticed a what looked like a bus stop just around the corner as well.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms were nice and simple design, great beds and a nice bathroom. The breakfast included with the stay was nice. Only thing which might bother you while staying here is that walking distance to the center of Luxembourg is reasonably far, but it's a nice walk with nice views so that's not too bad.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The Melia in Luxembourg is a new and very nice hotel. My room was of normal size and nice and clean. The hotel is located a bit off the city, but it's still possible to walk to nice restaurants, but it took 20 minutes and was a steap road, not good if you have walking problems. The staff at the reception desk was very helpful and friendly. I would certainly come back again when going to Luxembourg.
reviews.title: New and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Level Room and I have to say, one really should not stay anywhere else in Luxembourg. It came with a bath tub, something even the 5* competition can't offer, unless one books a suite of course, which I have also done in the past here. But I digress, the Melia is in a great part of town with great views and a pleasant walk in if one takes the path through the old battlements. Everything about this hotel is fabulous, I loved it and have to say that even though I came with my partner for leisure, as a business traveller I can state that it has certainly raised the bar and is without doubt a superior 4* hotel and was also the best hotel that I stayed in during the week of my Moselle holiday. Can't wait to come back again soon for a long weekend, hopefully in Autumn when the City is at it's visual best..
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: a very modern hotel, good room, better than good bathroom, attractive foyer/bar. right next to Mudam the new museum of modern art - really worth going into. Its only 5euros. i like contemporary art but if you don't you might like the architecture anyway. the melia itself is in the modern part of Luxembourg. No 16 bus from the airport deposits you by the Philharmonie for the princeloy sum of 1.50 euros and its a 2 minute walk to the front door of the hotel
reviews.title: great room, shame about the coffee

reviews.text: friendly reception staff with excellent english. there is a very small gym - 2 running machines a bike and some weights.
reviews.title: Excellent - highly recommended

reviews.text: but the coffee - at breakfast its lukewarm filter coffee or coffee from a machine where the coffee comes out of a carton - what happened to machines that use beans - or actually even things like nespresso are better. Food was fine - a previous reveiwer said it was dull but there were hot and cold choices and nice fruit. - all the usual things i thought.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, good location. Boring breakfast.

reviews.text: A very comfy place to stay for a couple of days
reviews.title: Friendly service, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Having read previous reviews of the Melia Luxembourg, I stayed for one night in June 2012 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The levels of service were superb as were the guest amenities. I booked as part of a conference and saved significantly on the room rate as well. One word of advice, the hotel is located away from the historic centre so not many places to eat / see nearby. Mind you the City is so small everything is just a short cab ride away. Well done Melia Luxembourg, I will definitely stay with you again and will try out the other Melia locations.
reviews.title: Despite the issues this place is top notch!
Good for short business stays
reviews.text: The hotel looks like a giant grey Jenga cube with windows functional but lacks any character. It is conveniently located a short drive from the airport close to the EU offices and banks. It's a short walk into the centre. The check-in was abysmal with a single clerk on reception with a queue of waiting guests. Not too difficult to estimate how many guests are going to check in and how long it takes to get from the airport to have the right number of staff on the front desk. The rooms were fine spacious and reasonably equipped but the carpeting was poor and decor spartan. The bathroom was a good size with a deep tub and overhead shower. The bed was fine but the pillows old be better, too low with one and too high with two. Internet access is available but costs €12 per day.  Did not take breakfast so could not comment on the quality.

reviews.title: Worst Melia Ever!
reviews.text: Overall the hotel provides a good business option but not necessarily one I would choose as a tourist option. Certainly, would consider using it again for business.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horrible, just horrible hotel. The location is quite well suited for political and cultural business, otherwise not very central (not that anything is really far in Luxembourg). There is no valet, which is fine, but the only parking they have is not theirs at all, it is a public parking building across the hotel (same price as for anybody else there).
reviews.title: Away from the mobs of tourists
fine
reviews.text: As all Melias do, the art is plentiful in the hotel, and the decor is very classy. The staff however are all quite slow to react and just don't seem to be eager to help out with anything.
The rooms are quite small and fitted with the most basic necessities. It was the no frills airline of hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Home Sweet Home!!!

description: In the heart of Luxembourg City, Melia Luxembourg is a new 4-star Melia Hotels International property located at the centre of the triangle-shaped Place de l'Europe, on the Kirchberg plateau. Directly opposite the Luxemburg Congress Center and in close proximity to several EU institutions, the hotel is within easy walking distance from the European Court of Justice, the Court of First Instance, the Court of Auditors of the European Communities, the Secretariat-General of the European Parliament, the European Investment Bank, the Translation Centre for the Bodies of the European Union and a number of offices of the European Commission. Designed by renowned international architect Jim Clemens and completed in 2009, Melia Luxembourg is a gem of contemporary architecture within the Luxembourg City skyline.
